task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 341°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, but the top is currently cut off, so I will tilt my view upwards.
I can now see the top of the building, but I need to see the base to estimate the full height, so I will look down.

Having seen the top at pitch 30 and the base at pitch -30, I can now estimate the total height by counting the floors; the building appears to have about 10 stories, and assuming a standard floor height of 3.5 to 4 meters including structure, the total height is approximately 35-40 meters.
